intro: Bellevalia zoharyi subsp. typica, commonly known as the typical Zohary's bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family, which includes other bulbous flowering plants. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture, particularly in rock gardens and dry landscapes.
